title: The META-NET Language White Paper Series: Overview and Key Results

author: Bolette Sandford Pedersen, Centre for Language Technology, University of Copenhagen
recorded by: German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI)

segmentation: So I will give you a brief status of the.
Of the language white papers and of the key results that they were trying to achieve with this serious.
Um?
Well, with this seriously, we basically wanted to develop an every strong instrument to address.
Decision makers and journalists in.
In the EU countries and inform them about the situation in the particular countries.

So we wanted to actually combine expert judgments of the actual situations in their respective countries with more political statements that could wait in a wave function as as a wake up call to decision makers in Europe.
So actually we are now coming to an end.
They are ready now for download, most of them and will come out in the paper version there soon to be distributed in all the countries.
The report covers sort of both status of the language situation as as a whole in the country and the level of support through language technology so.
First of all, is report contains a common chapter called Languages at Risk.
A challenge for language technology.
Where were language Psygnosis presented to the public?
In general terms and a lot of examples of applications are given which should be well known to most people and then further.
The shoes are followed by language specific chapters, which partly give a status of the of the languages as a home in the country and look into also.
Um political research programs in language technology.
The educational situations of language technology in the particular countries.
And finally, there's an expert chapter in the report which sort of give into more detailed description of the level of technological expertise and tools and resources in that particular country.
And finally.

We decided also to do some cross lingual evaluation so that you can not only see some of the internal status of your own language, but also compare with the with the other languages in in Europe and we believe that this would be also politically relevant.
Should be able to see where, where, where's my own language sort of position.
In the in the larger picture.

Find that the huge group of languages is placed in the fragmentary cluster and also we find home languages which can actually can be called excellent in their language.

And here you can see a final clustering of the different languages English as the first one, even if it is not excellent.

Key results that we can sum up well when it comes to language technology support.
There seems to be massive differences between the Europeans, languages and technology areas.

And they will have to be addressed in the years to come.
So today we will launch a new version of the language.
